intro: Campylocentrum queremalense, commonly known as the Malagasy orchid, is a tropical plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers, which bloom in clusters, exhibit a range of colors, including white, pink, and purple, making it a visually striking species.
